actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to extend and liberalize the deduction for individual retirement savings.

summary.text: Individual Retirement Savings Act of 1980 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase the allowable amount of the income tax deduction for contributions to an individual retirement account (IRA) to the lesser of $2,000 or the amount of an employee's taxable compensation. Permits active participants in tax-qualified retirement plans, tax-sheltered annuities, or governmental plans to claim an income tax deduction for contribution to an IRA up to a maximum of $500 for the taxable year. Disqualifies self-employed individuals and shareholder employees for the retirement savings deduction.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to extend and liberalize the deduction for individual retirement savings.
